Perfume The Story of a Murderer (2006) (Film)
Jean-Baptiste Grenouille, born with a superior olfactory sense, creates the world's finest perfume
His work, however, takes a dark turn as he searches for the ultimate scent.
Perfume: The Story of a Murderer is a German 2006 thriller film directed by Tom Tykwer,
written by Andrew Birkin, Bernd Eichinger and Tykwer and starring Ben Whishaw, Alan Rickman, Rachel Hurd-Wood and Dustin Hoffman.
It is based on the 1985 novel Perfume by Patrick SÃƒÂ¼skind. Set in 18th century France, the film tells the story of Jean-Baptiste Grenouille (Whishaw),
an olfactory genius, and his homicidal quest for the perfect scent.
